intro: Habracanthus congestus, commonly known as the clustered habracanthus, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or orange. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture, while its stems are woody and branched. This species is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
